page.title: 01Gazetteer
page.content: {Cannock Chase:}an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty of 26 square miles. It is an area of open countryside between the towns of Stafford, Rugeley and Cannock. The land is hilly with streams in the valleys. Part of the Chase is a Country Park and most of the rest is Forestry Commission land. {Cannock Chase Country Park} is mostly open land covered by bracken and heather, with Silver Birches and Oaks. {The Cannock Forest} is coniferous woodland. There are many beautiful walks and trails. The Chase is used for lots of different activities such as walking, picnics, horse-riding, fishing and wildlife spotting. {Slitting Mill}is a small village on the edge of the Chase just over 1 mile S.W. of Rugeley, Staffordshire.
